Title: Croatia completes pipeline to raise Krk LNG’s send-out capacity
Description: Croatian gas transmission system operator Plinacro has completed the Zlobin-Bosiljevo pipeline, which accommodates Krk LNG terminal’s increase in send-out capacity from 2.4 billion m3/year to 3.5 billion m3/year.
Author: JS

Title: OLT Offshore’s FSRU in Toscana to operate until 2044 following life extension works
Description: Italy’s 135,000 m3 FSRU Toscana will operate until the end of 2044 due to life extension work carried out on the vessel last year during the seven-month maintenance.
Author: JS

Title: Cheniere achieves substantial completion of first train of Corpus Christi Stage 3
Description: Cheniere said that it achieved “substantial completion” of the first of seven trains of the 10 mtpa Corpus Christi Stage 3 (CCL Stage 3) expansion project, less than a month after the announcement of shipping the project’s first LNG cargo.
Author: JS

Title: Equinor starts up production at new gas field for export to Europe
Description: Norway’s state-owned Equinor has started up production at the Halten East offshore gas field in the Norwegian Sea, which aims to meet the demand for Norwegian pipeline gas especially in Europe.
Author: JS

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG nears first LNG export as British Sponsor returns to berthing area
Description: The British Sponsor LNG tanker has returned to the berthing zone of the 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project, suggesting it may be preparing for a second loading that could complete the BP-led project’s first full cargo and mark its first LNG export.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside signs 15-year LNG supply deal with China Resources Gas
Description: Australian independent Woodside Energy has agreed to supply China Resources Gas International with 0.6 mtpa of LNG over 15 years, starting in 2027.
Author: CK

Title: Excelerate, PV Gas agree to collaborate on LNG supply for Vietnam
Description: Excelerate Energy has signed a memorandum of understanding with Vietnam’s state-owned PV Gas to collaborate on securing LNG supply from the US, with deliveries potentially starting as early as 2026.
Author: CK
